review: Fire has quickly taken over our TV. We've all but stopped watching Netflix, since Prime offers so many more movies and TV shows. The Amazon Originals shows are actually our favorites to watch. Lag is almost non-existent and the voice search recognizes different speech patterns and dialects with ease.UPDATE: The surface of the unit is a high-quality matte finish, which appears to help deflect scratches and dust. The unit does not come with an HDMI cable, so you will need to purchase one separately. I've recently started using the gaming feature of the Fire TV, which runs smaller games flawlessly. The system-intensive games almost universally require the gaming remote controller, which I have not yet tried. On the whole, I am very satisfied. I've gifted Fire to my family twice, as it makes a great gift for >$100. I do highly recommend.Amazon Fire TV

review: Based on the number of excellent reviews, I purchased this to use primarily with MLB.tv, Netflix & Amazon Prime videos.  The first issue was during the setup process when the unit and the remote control just would not communicate with each other.  After a repositioning the unit a few times I finally got it to work, but even then I found myself needing to press the buttons on the remote a few times before the unit responded.Then I fired up a live streaming baseball game using the MLB.tv app.  The picture quality was excellent, but then it started the whole freezing/buffering/restarting/buffering routine.  This was happening every 30 seconds or so, making it impossible to watch a game.  Streaming Netflix or Amazon videos was a bit better but still not perfect.I ended up returning the Amazon Fire TV and replacing it with a Roku 3.  The Roku has performed pretty much flawlessly.It's a shame because I really wanted to like the Fire TV.
